timeline.message:
Support vertx-web and micrometer

Correct micrometer-deployment dependencies
Update micrometer-jmx IT to use vertx-web and not resteasy
Ensure vertx-web routes are matched to micrometer uri tag format
Resolves #12182

Support vertx-web and micrometer

Correct micrometer-deployment dependencies
Update micrometer-jmx IT to use vertx-web and not resteasy
Ensure vertx-web routes are matched to micrometer uri tag format
Resolves #12182

Support vertx-web and micrometer

Correct micrometer-deployment dependencies
Update micrometer-jmx IT to use vertx-web and not resteasy
Ensure vertx-web routes are matched to micrometer uri tag format
Resolves #12182

timeline.bodyText: if order is set to four, then who's getting 3?
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: Just want to make sure it done on purpose.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: There were two 3s.... the test before this is also 3. It doesn't really matter that much.. the important bit is the deferral of the last one (10) so it can check prometheus results w/ all requests present.. but having 3 twice bugged me.
replies.author: ebullient

replies.bodyText: when using @order, we must be sure to not have multiple tests with the same order or the ordering is not predictable. So, the change is absolutely right.
replies.author: cescoffier
